results.title: Toronto jazz
results.creator_credit: Don Owen, Roman Kroitor and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Toronto is regarded as the third largest jazz centre in North America. This film features a cross-section of jazz bands of that city: the Lenny Breau Trio, the Don Thompson Quintet and the Alf Jones Quartet. Their styles show creative self-expression, hard work, and improvisation.

results.title: Tomorrow's Canberra
results.creator_credit: Don Murray, The Film House, Australian Commonwealth Film Unit and Fred Schepisi
results.brief_description: Impressions of planning projects before the N.C.D.C. from a design by Chicago architect Walter Burley Griffin, with views of development in Canberra as at 1972. Shows the Commission in discussion with advisory groups about such projects as the “Parliamentary Triangle” development and Tuggeranong.

results.title: Together
results.creator_credit: Denis Horn, Lorenzo Mazzetti and British Film Institute
results.brief_description: The story of two deaf mutes who work on the docks and live together in a dingy lodging house. A study in isolation - influenced by the Italian neo-realist school. One of the first films of the British ‘Free Cinema’ movement.

results.title: To see or not to see
results.creator_credit: Bretislav Pojar, Wolf Koenig, Robert Verrall and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Here the Czech film-artist Bretislav Pojar amusingly reflects on our habit of looking before we leap. What he shows us is the little person inside each of us, the cautious character we all know, who acts to keep us out of trouble but also in a state of defeat. Is there a cure for this reluctance to face up to life in the raw? The film shows there is. With the Pojar charm working for you, your worst fears suddenly look plain silly.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Bretislav Pojar, Wolf Koenig, Robert Verrall and National Film Board of Canada

results.title: Thrill of the surf
results.brief_description: One of Australia’s national sports vividly pictured for those who live far from an ocean beach. Shows ocean beaches along the coast of New South Wales where surfing is more popular than any other sport. Its thrills include surf-boarding, surf skiing and life-savers rowing surf boats. The lifesaving clubs which exist all along the coastline have more than 13,000 rescues to their credit to date (1949).

results.title: Three types of welds
results.brief_description:
Episode number 6 of Series “Gas Welding”
Part of a series of nine short instructional films showing methods for oxyacetylene welding from setting-up procedures, through flame adjustments. This part describes the types of welds that can be used in gas welding.

results.title: Three to go: Judy
results.creator_credit: Gil Brealey, Brian Hannant and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description: Part of a trilogy concerning the problems of young people in Australia. Judy is a young girl who lives in a large provincial city. Like most girls of her age, she longs to get out and see life, to find the fun, romance and adventure. She wants to go to the big city to work. The film shows the last few weeks before she leaves home. We meet her parents, workmates and boy friend. In their comments we discover some of the problems a teenage girl has to face when living in a large country town.
